Package com.pureperfect.ferret.vfs

A lightweight Virtual File System (VFS) for file system / network / class path scanning.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Archive Represents an archive on the virtual file system; usually a JAR or ZIP file.
ArchiveEntry Represents an entry in an archive on the virtual file system.
ClassFile A Java class file.
Container A container is a PathElement that contains other PathElements.
Directory Represents a directory on the virtual file system.
File Represents a file on the virtual file system.
PathElement A resource on the Virtual File System (VFS).
WebDirectory A directory in a web application (WAR).
WebFile A file in a web application (WAR File).
 

Class Summary
FileSystem An implementation of a lightweight Virtual File System (VFS) appropriate for scanning.
WebFileSystem An implementation of a lightweight Virtual File System (VFS) appropriate for scanning in a WAR file / web application.
 

Package com.pureperfect.ferret.vfs Description

A lightweight Virtual File System (VFS) for file system / network / class path scanning. Most Ferret users should not have to worry about the classes in this package beyond knowing how to tell the difference between a zip file and a class file or directory. Underlying resources on the file system or on the network will be mapped to one of the following VFS types:

Actual ResourceVFS Type
A directory on the local file systemDirectory
A file on the local file systemFile
A zip, jar or other archive file on the local file systemArchive
A zip, jar or other archive file on the networkArchive
A generic file inside an archiveArchiveEntry
A Java™ class in a directoryClassFile
A Java™ class in an archiveClassFile
A Java™ class on the networkTODO
A generic file on the networkTODO
